tafsirQuiz.question: What is the main message of Surah Nuh, Ayah 1?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The message that he gave to the corrupted people of those days has been put here in three words—worship (‘ibadah), fear of God (taqwa) and obedience to the Prophet (ita‘ah), i
distractors: This verse talks about the Day of Judgment only
This verse is about the battles of early Muslims

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: It is evident from the utterances of Noah that his way of delivering the divine message is identical with that adopted in the Quran for inviting people to the Truth
distractors: This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce
This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: One who is living in the knowledge of the Majesty of God is a real God-worshipper, while one whose heart is not immersed in God’s greatness is not a true believer
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The great ones of the time arrogantly rejected the call for Truth, while lesser mortals rejected it because the great ones had done so. The reason for this was that they thought that, compared to the words of Noah, the utterances of those who had attained a higher status from the worldly point of...

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: So, they made Noah’s mission look dubious to the people by saying that he was treading a new path, straying from the path of their revered forebears. Gradually they became sanctified and ultimately people started worshipping them

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: It appears from Noah’s prayer that, in his own times, evil had reached its final limit. Misguided beliefs and thoughts had become so prevalent in society that any child born and brought up in this society would have gone astray

tafsirQuiz.question: Which concept is emphasized in Surah Nuh, Ayah 27?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In this world, in addition to human beings and angels, there is another set of creatures known as jinn. Just as there are foolish leaders who misguide the common people, similarly there are foolish leaders among the jinn, who go on misguiding them with deceitful utterances
